tutorial.welcome.title: Welcome to EduGrade!
tutorial.welcome.content:
This interactive tour will guide you through EduGrade.

You'll learn by doing - creating a category, setting up grade ranges, adding a student, and managing grades!

Click "Next" to begin.
tutorial.openCategories.title: Step 1: Open Grade Settings
tutorial.openCategories.content:
First, let's create a grade category.

Click the "Grade Settings" button in the sidebar to open the settings.
tutorial.addCategory.title: Add a Category
tutorial.addCategory.content:
Now click "Add Category" to create your first grade category.

Categories define grade types like "Schularbeit", "Test", or "Mitarbeit".
tutorial.fillCategory.title: Create Your Category
tutorial.fillCategory.content:
Fill in the form:

1. Enter a name (e.g., "Schularbeit")
2. Set the weight (e.g., 50 for 50%)
3. Click "Save" to create it

The weight determines how much this category counts toward the final grade.
tutorial.gradeRangesTab.title: Grade Ranges Tab
tutorial.gradeRangesTab.content:
Notice the tabs at the top of this dialog:

• Categories - Manage your grade categories
• Grade Ranges - Set percentage thresholds
• +/~/- Settings - Configure plus/neutral/minus grades

Click the "Grade Ranges" tab to see the settings.
tutorial.gradeRanges.title: Grade Ranges Explained
tutorial.gradeRanges.content:
Here you configure percentage-to-grade conversion:

• Grade 1: 85-100% (Sehr Gut)
• Grade 2: 70-84% (Gut)
• Grade 3: 55-69% (Befriedigend)
• Grade 4: 40-54% (Genügend)
• Grade 5: 0-39% (Nicht Genügend)

These are used when entering grades as percentages.

Close this dialog to continue.
tutorial.addStudent.title: Step 2: Add a Student
tutorial.addStudent.content:
Now let's add a student to your class.

Click the "Add Student" button.
tutorial.fillStudent.title: Enter Student Name
tutorial.fillStudent.content:
Enter the student's name and click "Add".

You can use any name you like!
tutorial.addGrade.title: Step 3: Add a Grade
tutorial.addGrade.content:
Your student is ready for grades!

Click the + button in the student's row to add a grade.
tutorial.fillGrade.title: Enter the Grade
tutorial.fillGrade.content:
Fill in the grade form:

1. Select a category
2. Choose input method:
   • "Grade" tab: Enter grade directly (1-6)
   • "Percentage" tab: Enter % and auto-convert
3. Optionally add a name (e.g., "SA1")
4. Click "Save"

Try entering a percentage like 87% to see it convert to a grade!
tutorial.viewResults.title: Grade Added!
tutorial.viewResults.content:
Look at the table - you can see:

• The student's name
• The calculated average
• The final grade (1-5)
• The number of grades

To see individual grades, you need to click on the student!
tutorial.studentDetail.title: Step 4: Open Detail View
tutorial.studentDetail.content:
Now let's look at the individual grades!

Click on a student in the table to open the detail view.

There you'll see:
• All individual grades
• Statistics and charts
• A search function for grades
tutorial.gradeList.title: Grade List
tutorial.gradeList.content:
Here you see all of the student's grades:

• Date, category, and grade value
• Edit buttons (pencil icon)
• Grades can be crossed out (excluded from average)
• Use the search field above to filter

Click "Next" to learn how to edit grades.
tutorial.editGrade.title: Step 5: Edit a Grade
tutorial.editGrade.content:
Now let's edit a grade!

Click the edit button (pencil) next to any grade in the table.

In the dialog you can:
• Change the value (grade or percentage)
• Add a name
• Exclude the grade from average
• Delete the grade
tutorial.yearsAndSubjects.title: Years & Subjects
tutorial.yearsAndSubjects.content:
EduGrade organizes data by school years:

• Select a year here or add new ones (e.g., "2024/2025")
• Use the subject tabs to switch between subjects
• Click "+" on the subject tabs to create new subjects
• Each year has its own students, grades, and subjects

This lets you manage multiple school years and subjects at once!
tutorial.complete.title: Congratulations!
tutorial.complete.content:
You've mastered the basics of EduGrade!

Key features:
• Create categories with weights
• Configure grade ranges (Grade Ranges tab)
• Enter grades directly or as percentages
• Click on students for detail view
• Edit grades with the edit button
• Export your data regularly!

Years & Subjects:
• Add school years (e.g., 2024/2025) via the year dropdown
• Manage multiple subjects per year with subject tabs
• Students and grades are organized by year
• Easily switch between years and subjects

Additional features:
• Search grades by name, category, or date
• Export student details as PDF
• Exclude grades from average calculation
• Use +/~/- grades for participation

Happy grading!
